resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on pull request #4582: ARROW-4343: [C++] Add docker-compose test for gcc 4.8 / Ubuntu 14.04 (Trusty)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582
 
 
   This also fixes a build failure ARROW-5617 resulting from thrift_ep needing to be pointed to the output of boost_ep when ARROW_BOOST_VENDORED=ON

kou commented on issue #4582: ARROW-4343: [C++] Add docker-compose test for gcc 4.8 / Ubuntu 14.04 (Trusty)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582#issuecomment-502406513
 
 
   Ubuntu 14.04 LTS isn't maintained since 2019-04. (Ubuntu 14.04 EVM is still maintained.)
   Should we still support Ubuntu 14.04?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #4582: ARROW-4343: [C++] Add docker-compose test for gcc 4.8 / Ubuntu 14.04 (Trusty)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582#issuecomment-502479652
 
 
   @kou I don't think we should formally support Ubuntu 14.04, but I think this is mainly to be able to test that the package still builds on a completely pre-gcc5 compiler toolchain

wesm commented on issue #4582: ARROW-4343: [C++] Add docker-compose test for gcc 4.8 / Ubuntu 14.04 (Trusty)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582#issuecomment-502479814
 
 
   On Ubuntu 16.04 I'm getting linking failures due to OpenSSL
   
   ```
   [486/565] Linking CXX executable debug/flight-test-server
   FAILED: : && /usr/bin/ccache /usr/bin/g++   -fdiagnostics-color=always -ggdb -O0  -Wall -Wno-conversion -Wno-sign-conversion -Wno-unused-variable -Werror -Wno-attributes -msse4.2  -g   src/arrow/flight/CMakeFiles/flight-test-server.dir/test-server.cc.o  -o debug/flight-test-server  -rdynamic debug/libarrow_flight_testing.so.14.0.0 debug/libarrow_testing.so.14.0.0 /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdouble-conversion.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcrypto.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libbrotlienc.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libbrotlidec.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libbrotlicommon.so /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/protobuf_ep-install/lib/libprotobuf.a orc_ep-install/lib/liborc.a /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglog.so -ldl /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdouble-conversion.so boost_ep-prefix/src/boost_ep/stage/lib/libboost_system.a boost_ep-prefix/src/boost_ep/stage/lib/libboost_filesystem.a boost_ep-prefix/src/boost_ep/stage/lib/libboost_regex.a debug//libgtest_maind.so debug//libgmockd.so -ldl /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/protobuf_ep-install/lib/libprotobuf.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libgrpc++.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libgrpc.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libgpr.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/cares_ep-install/lib/libcares.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libaddress_sorting.a gflags_ep-prefix/src/gflags_ep/lib/libgflags.a debug//libgtestd.so debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0 /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libgrpc++.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libgrpc.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libgpr.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/cares_ep-install/lib/libcares.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/grpc_ep-install/lib/libaddress_sorting.a debug/libarrow.so.14.0.0 /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdouble-conversion.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcrypto.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libbrotlienc.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libbrotlidec.so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libbrotlicommon.so orc_ep-install/lib/liborc.a /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/protobuf_ep-install/lib/libprotobuf.a /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglog.so -ldl jemalloc_ep-prefix/src/jemalloc_ep/dist//lib/libjemalloc_pic.a -pthread -lrt -Wl,-rpath,/build/cpp/debug && :
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_next_protos_advertised_cb'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_session_id_context'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_ctrl'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_cipher_list'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_use_certificate'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_do_handshake'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_get_ex_new_index'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_read'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_load_error_strings'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_get0_alpn_selected'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_free'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_new'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_set_session'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_set_accept_state'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_get_cert_store'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_get_peer_certificate'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_get_ex_data'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `d2i_SSL_SESSION'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_client_CA_list'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_alpn_select_cb'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_get0_next_proto_negotiated'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_new'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_set_SSL_CTX'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_get_error'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_set_bio'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_set_connect_state'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_state_string_long'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `i2d_SSL_SESSION'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_ex_data'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_ctrl'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_get_servername'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_state_string'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_library_init'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_write'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_verify'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `TLSv1_2_method'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_check_private_key'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_state'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_alpn_protos'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_callback_ctrl'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_sess_set_new_cb'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_set_next_proto_select_cb'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_SESSION_free'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_set_info_callback'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_free'
   debug/libarrow_flight.so.14.0.0: undefined reference to `SSL_get_SSL_CTX'
   collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
   ```
   
   It appears that `-lssl` or similar is not being passed. There is no mention of OpenSSL in https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/flight/CMakeLists.txt so I have reopened ARROW-3290

kou commented on issue #4582: ARROW-4343: [C++] Add docker-compose test for gcc 4.8 / Ubuntu 14.04 (Trusty), expand Xenial/16.04 Dockerfile to test Flight
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582#issuecomment-502486723
 
 
   > I think this is mainly to be able to test that the package still builds on a completely pre-gcc5 compiler toolchain
   
   I understand.
   CentOS 7 may be better than Ubuntu 14.04 for this purpose. Because CentOS 7 is a supported platform (we're providing RPM packages for CentOS 7) and CentOS 7 ships GCC 4.8.5.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582#issuecomment-502502050
 
 
   It looks like the OpenSSL in Ubuntu 14.04 is too old for gRPC, so I'm disabling Flight in the build for now
   
   ```
   [886/1324] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/grpc++_unsecure.dir/src/cpp/client/insecure_credentials.cc.o
   FAILED: /usr/bin/g++  -DCARES_STATICLIB -DPB_FIELD_32BIT -I/build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep/include -I/build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep -I/arrow/cpp/thirdparty/protobuf_ep-install/include -I/build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep/third_party/address_sorting/include -I/build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep/third_party/nanopb -isystem /arrow/cpp/thirdparty/cares_ep-install/include -ggdb -O0 -g -fPIC -std=c++11 -g -fPIC   -fno-exceptions -fno-rtti -MD -MT CMakeFiles/grpc_cronet.dir/src/core/tsi/ssl_transport_security.cc.o -MF CMakeFiles/grpc_cronet.dir/src/core/tsi/ssl_transport_security.cc.o.d -o CMakeFiles/grpc_cronet.dir/src/core/tsi/ssl_transport_security.cc.o -c /build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep/src/core/tsi/ssl_transport_security.cc

                           X509_V_FLAG_PARTIAL_CHAIN | X509_V_FLAG_TRUSTED_FIRST);

   /build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep/src/core/tsi/ssl_transport_security.cc:659:52: error: 'X509_V_FLAG_TRUSTED_FIRST' was not declared in this scope
                           X509_V_FLAG_PARTIAL_CHAIN | X509_V_FLAG_TRUSTED_FIRST);

      SSL_get0_alpn_selected(impl->ssl, &alpn_selected, &alpn_selected_len);

                  static_cast<unsigned int>(impl->alpn_protocol_list_length))) {

   /build/cpp/grpc_ep-prefix/src/grpc_ep/src/core/tsi/ssl_transport_security.cc: In function 'tsi_result tsi_create_ssl_server_handshaker_factory_with_options(const tsi_ssl_server_handshaker_options*, tsi_ssl_server_handshaker_factory**)':
   ```

kou commented on pull request #4582: ARROW-4343: [C++] Add docker-compose test for gcc 4.8 / Ubuntu 14.04 (Trusty), expand Xenial/16.04 Dockerfile to test Flight
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4582#discussion_r294156240
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/flight/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -25,12 +25,15 @@ configure_file(arrow-flight.pc.in "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/arrow-flight.pc"
 install(FILES "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/arrow-flight.pc"
         DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}/pkgconfig/")
 
+set(ARROW_OPENSSL_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto OpenSSL::SSL)
+
 set(ARROW_FLIGHT_STATIC_LINK_LIBS
     protobuf::libprotobuf
     gRPC::grpc++
     gRPC::grpc
     gRPC::gpr
-    c-ares::cares)
+    c-ares::cares
+    ${ARROW_OPENSSL_LIBS})
 
 Review comment:
   I'm not tested yet but the following may fix this:
   
   ```diff
   diff --git a/cpp/CMakeLists.txt b/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
   index ea6aa74c..d9074081 100644
   --- a/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
   +++ b/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
   @@ -561,9 +561,9 @@ if(ARROW_WITH_URIPARSER)
    endif()
    
    if(ARROW_USE_OPENSSL)
   -  list(APPEND ARROW_LINK_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto)
   -  list(APPEND ARROW_STATIC_LINK_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto)
   -  list(APPEND ARROW_STATIC_INSTALL_INTERFACE_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto)
   +  list(APPEND ARROW_LINK_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto OpenSSL::SSL)
   +  list(APPEND ARROW_STATIC_LINK_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto OpenSSL::SSL)
   +  list(APPEND ARROW_STATIC_INSTALL_INTERFACE_LIBS OpenSSL::Crypto OpenSSL::SSL)
    endif()
    
    if(ARROW_WITH_BROTLI)
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Until we formally stop supporting Trusty it would be useful to be able to verify in Docker that builds work there. I still have an Ubuntu 14.04 machine that I use (and I've been filing bugs that I find on it) but not sure for how much longer
fields.summary: [C++] Add as complete as possible Ubuntu Trusty / 14.04 build to docker-compose setup

comments.body:
see also https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4357

@wesm, are you suggesting that we restore the entry for trusty in travis ?

Not sure, but I think we should have nightly and on-demand crossbow builds that run on Trusty. Due to the conda-forge gcc7 migration, maintaining Trusty support has grown to be more of a pain.

I've been able to get the conda-forge stuff working on Trusty with some effort so we might make the Travis build entry that builds Gandiva on Java use trusty, so we have both trusty and xenial CI entries

I can take care of this but I'm unsure what kind of support do we want to test? Build as much possible with system packages? Build using our bundled ExternalProject setup? Or using the conda toolchain (then we would also need to use their compilers and nothing from trusty except libc)?
What does it mean now that Ubuntu Trusty is no longer an LTS release?
I'm pretty worried about our gcc 4.8 build so I'm trying to get something basic up and running
